dialogues.text: Care to join me? With a grin, he slips into the crowd as Nottingham arrives. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shine like the sun, my lady. He raises her hand, as he did the girl's in the castle. Kisses it. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have been meeting with young Robin of Locksley. (as she tries to hide her shock) My cousin tells me the knave deprived you of some horses. MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recovering) Yes. A most disagreeable experience.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I deeply regret it, and I promise you he will be brought to justice. For subjecting you to such treatment, I will hang him from the walls with his own entrails. That gleam of insanity.   Robin watches from a distance. MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would like to see that, my lord. The Sheriff places his hand possessively on her shoulder. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dear, a woman of your refinement is not safe living alone. If you would consent to bring your household within the city walls, I could give your needs my most personal attention. MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thank you, Lord Nottingham, from the heart, but for now I prefer to stay in my family's ancestral home. My cousin, King Richard, will be deeply moved to hear of your concern for my welfare. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alas, the King has many enemies both abroad and at home. I fear for his safe return. MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear not, my dear Sheriff. He will return. When he does, he will wish to reward his faithful subjects. The Sheriff smiles sourly and takes his leave. Marian deflates with relief. The Sheriff walks alone towards a side door. BEGGAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Robin) Alms, my lord. Nottingham makes to shove the man aside. With a swift move, the beggar grabs the Sheriff in a headlock. Slides Nottingham's own dagger to his throat and drags him out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred crowns, Sheriff?   You insult me. Nottingham starts to struggle.   Robin draws blood. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember young Robin of Locksley, Sheriff? Meet Robin Hood. Your nemesis. Your avenging angel. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you kill me, you will hang. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I kill you, I will hang happy. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want? ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to give you a chance. A chance you do not deserve. A chance to right your wrongs. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm listening. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From this day forward you will cease to tax my people. You will renounce the charges against my father, and you will return his lands to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should I? ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because for every harm you do, I swear by God I shall visit on you threefold in return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty words. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am here with a blade at your throat. As long as I live, you will always know that I could be here again. A YELL from across the church. Gisborne has spotted them. Robin digs the knife a little deeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your answer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never, fool. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it will begin.. Gisborne yells orders.   Robin hurls Nottingham against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin runs to the courtyard and leaps on the Sheriff's horse, which is held by a stunned groom. He rides through the busy marketplace. A crossbowman tracks him. A sure shot. Marian spots the danger. She fakes being tripped and stumbles into the bowman. His bolt flies harmlessly into the air. MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (innocently) Please excuse my clumsiness. Robin charges for the city gate. As he passes, he kicks the guard who hasseled him into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men gather around as Robin dismounts, admiring the horse. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A personal loan from the Sheriff. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious) You should not have left without me, Englishman. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How so? You have not raised a finger to protect me. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before I had a choice. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was my choice to do this alone.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A foolish risk. If you had been killed, I would be cursed for eternity for failing to fulfil my pledge. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aslan, if I didn't know better, I would swear you were worried about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff maniacally spits out orders to Gisborne. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starve them out. Slaughter their livestock. I want to see Locksley's own people fighting each other to bring him to us. GISBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear he will not live to see the next full moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SQUEALING HOG is loaded onto a wagon. SOLDIERS round up the livestock. An old FARMER protests. FARMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go' bless ya, sir. Leave us the sow. She's with young 'uns. The next litter'll feed us through the winter. SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've heard of Robin Hood? FARMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. The Soldier brutally kicks the old man to the ground. SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then pray he is brought to us before winter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A trail of refugees. Women and children carry their belongings into camp.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Wulf runs to greet his mother and siblings.    A continge of woodsmen confronts Robin. WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You brought this misery on us, Locksley. We can barely feed ourselves. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff hasn't left us a bloody pot to piss in. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we shall take from him and his rich friends. This provokes a barrage of protests.   The men are angry. WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brave talk, Locksley. I say we take the rich boy in. Murmurs of general agreement. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, do you think the Sheriff will give everything back after I am gone? WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He will give us the reward, and our pardons. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Will. You can take me in on one condition. You must fight me. You may use the Sheriff's horse and arm yourself as you please. I will fight on foot. Unarmed. WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unarmed? ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you lose, you will accept me as your leader. If you win, you may take me in. Dead or alive. WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead, Locksley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands tighten a girth. Will confidently jokes with his cronies. Woodsmen form a primitive circle of spectators. Little John and his wife, Fanny, keep to themselves, while Wulf openly talks with Robin, Aslan and Duncan. Robin is stripped to the waist, his muscled skin ravaged with scars. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man has true purpose.    He means to kill you. DUNCAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you have given him the means. WULF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will is ruthless, Robin.    Guard your back. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am grateful for your concern, friends, but I have to prove to them it is possible to overcome unequal odds. (shouts) I am ready, Will. Will bends, as if checking the horse's legs. Secretly grabs a handful of sand. Swings into the saddle and digs in his heels. Closing in, Will flings the sand in Robin's eyes. Robin clutches his hands to his face, blinded. Will spins back to the attack. His sword slashes. Reacting to the sound, Robin rolls aside. The men cheer like a big fight crowd. Robin's POV is blurred. Ducking the blade, he grabs Will's arm. A blow glances off his shoulder. Robin falls to his knees, still blinded. Will rides right at him, to trample him. Robin scrambles away. Will wheels his horse. A flashing hoof grazes Robin's chest. Robin leaps to his feet and yells at the top of his lungs. Panicked, the HORSE rears, WHINNYING wildly. Will struggles to stay in the saddle. Loses his sword. Robin seizes the moment and runs to a water trough. Douses his face. Yells at Will.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you little piss pot. Do your worst! Will grabs a spear from a bystander. Robin stands his ground. Will lunges, Robin sidesteps. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horse is smarter than you are, Will. Some of the men laugh. Will is incensed. Robin ducks and weaves, easily evading Will's repeated charges. Robin ducks right under the horse's belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, Will!   You aim like a girl, Will! Will stabs wildly, more and more frustrated. Laughter spreads, as Robin plays hide and seek around the horse's legs. Grabbing the end of the spear, he clowns a tug of war. Enraged, Will strains and tries to kick Robin away. Suddenly, Robin lets go. Unbalanced, Will flies back- wards off his mount. Robin snatches the spear and raises it over his fallen adversary. The crowd falls silent. Robin strikes. The point quivers in the ground below Will's crotch. Will wriggles in terror. Impaled, his pants rip open. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank the Lord you are not endowed like Bull. The crowd is convulsed with laughter. Robin catches his breath. Does not see Will, who grabs a heavy staff and runs at him. A strong hand grasps Will's arm as he is about to strike. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bollocks, Will. Jus' bugger off, eh? Overpowered, Will relents.   With a defiant glance, he skulks away. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya got us by the short and curlies, Robin Hood. Now let's hear what ya got to bleedin' say.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Robin scans the faces.     He has their attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nottingham has taken from us everything we own. Now we are going to start taking from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Ow in bloody blazes are we gonna do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are going to tax him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Autumn. The forest is a mosaic of green, gold, orange, and red. A giant eye in a circle of glass. Aslan, his telescope raised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here they come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two wagons.   Twenty escort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty?   They usually have five. He grabs the telescope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A phalanx of   mounted soldiers, a cart loaded with barrels, and   a tax wagon. The wagon is an armored box o wheels, with   crossbow slits in the side. Guy of Gisborn commands the   escort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is no ordinary convoy. Bull calls up from below, where a ragged group of woods- men lies nervously in ambush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'ow many?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Er, about ten. (then, to Aslan) Why scare them? They can't count anyway. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they call me the barbarian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. Together they run down the hill, keeping low. Gisborne eyes the forest. The beer cart is steered by a fat red-faced FRIAR, raucously singing hymns and quaffing from a jug, which he repeatedly dips into one of the barrels. ARROWS WHISTLE in. The Friar yells and drops his jug. A soldier is hit. At the forest edge, four woodsmen reload their longbows. Dressed in green, their faces camouflaged. The mounted soldiers charge them. The  woodsmen run into the trees. As the horsemen close in,  the runners leap into a trench. Lift up matted screens  of brush and grass. It's as if they disappeared.   The soldiers slash wildly at the thick screens. More arrows fly. More soldiers fall. The others spin in confusion, trying to discern the enemy. More woods- men break from cover. Run down a narrow path. Gisborne urges his men to pursue. They ride in single file, beating their way through the tangled branches. The runners dive into the trees, as other men haul on ropes, raising a giant screen in the soldiers' path. The horses swerve, on the edge of a twenty-foot drop to the river gorge. Momentum  carries many of them over the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON ROADWAY
dialogues.text: Robin and Aslan swing down from the trees onto the tax wagon. Kick down the two drivers and take the reins, steering the wagon off the road. The archers inside are unable to fire at them. Little John leaps onto the beer cart, sending the Friar hurtling back among the barrels. The Friar slams his head and drops unconscious. John whips the horse, driving the cart after Robin. Another camouflage screen is lifted into place, covering their route.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gisborne races back to the road... the wagons are gone. He rides frantically back and forth. Searching and cursing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin climbs onto the tax wagon's roof.     Angry shouts from inside. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surrender your weapons. I give you my word you shall go free. In answer, a swordblade jabs up through the roof, near his feet. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, I feared as much. He signals to Aslan, who steers the tax wagon into the river. Water floods in through the slits. Inside, panic. Drowning rats. The bowmen scramble out. What they see stops them dead. Both banks are men in green, longbows aimed directly at them.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTRYSIDE
dialogues.text: Sparks. An axe pounds into the lock of a strongbox. The lock snaps. Little John pries open the lid. Reacts in astonishment. The trunk is filled to the brim with glittering gold coins. The woodsmen press around. Cheers of celebration. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awestruck) I'll be buggered. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This treasure had a purpose.     We must find out what. He turns at the sound of a brawl from the Friar's cart. The Friar is at the bottom of a struggling heap of bodies

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off him.   He's a man of the cloth. Robin drags the men off. The Friar clambers to his feet. Around him are strewn battered and winded woodsmen.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lord's blessing on you, kind sir. These sinners were attempting to steal these libations destined for the monks of St. Catherine's. He indicates his cargo of barrels. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It appears to me, Reverend Friar, that many of the libations have found their way into your own esteemed person. Ignoring him, the Friar mounts the cart. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thousand pardons, sir, but duty beckons. I must hasten on. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing the bridle) A moment, my reverend friend. You travel with poor company when you travel with Nottingham's soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, tax him. This sparks a chorus of comments. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My men are thirsty and have much to celebrate. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord bless me, sir, are these your men? I had mistook them for common thieves. Kindly step aside. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surely the Lord has the charity to spare a few barrels to good Christian men. The Friar relents, loosening his grip on the reins. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sir, if you wish them to share in the good Lord's brew... Casually reaching under the seat, he pulls out a club. Smites Robin with it.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... you must best me for it. Robin staggers. The Friar whips up the horse. Dazed, Robin grabs for the fat man's leg. Gets a holy sandal full in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giddyup, nag! The Friar's horse, as obese as his driver, slowly raises his head from the grass and ambles forward. Robin runs after them and dives at the Friar, toppling him from the cart. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You leave when I say. Scrambling to his feet, the Friar glances skyward. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Protect me, Lord. He sweeps his foot, knocking Robin's legs out from under him. Hurls his full body weight on top of him. Whooomf!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yield! He bounces on Robin's stomach. Robin can barely breathe. The woodsmen are enjoying the spectacle. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confess that Friar Tuck is a better, holier, and braver man than thou art, knave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never!   Whoomf!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yield, I say!    Yield to Friar Tuck. Desperate, Robin bites the Friar's leg. Tuck howls. Robin extricates himself, grabs for a weapon. Smashes the Friar's head with his drinking jug. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yield yourself! He dives onto the Friar and hammers his head into the ground.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yield to Robin Hood. Tuck holds up a hand in surrender.    Robin eases off. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feeling his head) Thank you, Lord, for teaching me humility. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Friar Tuck. We have need of an honest man of God, to minister to these men and their families. What do you say? The Friar struggles to his feet. He reviews the motley faces of his potential flock. His eyes light on the grinning Saracen. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather roast in hell. He punches Robin in the gut.

dialogues.speaker: FRIAR TUCK
dialogues.text: strapped into the traces, pulls the beer cart. Sweating profusely, grunting with strain. His horse contentedly follows. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giddyup, Friar. He flicks the reins, steering the cart into camp. Women and children rush to greet their men. Jeer the roped soldier-prisoners. The Friar checks out his flock. A woman curtsies, another crosses herself, children touch his robe in wonder. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you say now, Tuck?    Here are the meek of the earth. Tuck surveys the hopeful, hungry faces. The little hamlet of half-built huts. He folds his hands in a moment of prayer. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lord moves in mysterious ways. I accept.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will not regret it. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, but you may.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blazing fire. Deer carcasses roast. Tuck's barrels supply the refreshment. Robin and Aslan pass out coins to each family. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buy yourself a new son, Stephen. FARMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thankee, Robin. Little John and Bull approach. John indicates the two prisoners roped to a nearby tree. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cain't get a bleedin' squeak outa 'em, Rob. BULL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'd be spittin' it out good if they'd knowed anythin'. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reckon the Cap'n knows summat, Rob, but stubborn ol' cocker 'e is. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps it is time for some heathen persuasion.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN OF SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: stares up at Robin defiantly. CAPTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spare your breath. I know nothing. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reasonable) I believe you. But this Arab here, he's got it into his barbarian brain that you know a whole lot more than nothing. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ROBIN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when he gets like this, he's very hard to reason with. With a hair-raising war cry, Aslan   leaps INTO VIEW. Stripped to the waist, brandishing   his scimitar. The Captain tries to back away. Robin    tries to restrain Aslan, is hurled aside. Snarling,    drooling at the mout Aslan explores the Captain's body   with his hands. A butcher checking meat. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I strongly advise you to talk. He hasn't eaten in weeks. CAPTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising terror) What does he want? ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You. CAPTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Godsakes, get him off me! ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very deliberately) No, Aslan... not this one, Aslan. ... How about this other one?... Fatter, yes... more meat. The other soldier, who definitely  has more flesh on the bone, is struck dumb with horror,  as Aslan turns his attention to him. With one swing   of his sword, Aslan slices through the man's ropes.   Drags him to his feet. Little John runs over. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgent) No, Robin, no! They be God-fearin' men. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot stop him, John. Besides, if they will not tell what they know, then they must pay the price. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill 'em aye, but not like this. 'Tain't Christian. Blood-curdling SCREAMS from behind the wagon where Aslan has dragged his victim. The Captain's face pales. Then silence.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The demented Arab slowly reappears. Blood drips from his lips. He munches the flesh from a long bone, on the end of which is the soldier's glove... the man's arm. Turning to Robin, Aslan shouts in Arabic and gesticulates wildly at the Captain. CAPTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does he say? ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, roughly, he says that he doesn't care for the way your friend tastes, and he wants you. CAPTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, God, no! I'll talk. Just keep him away. Keep him away!

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND WAGON
dialogues.text: Bull holds the other prisoner, muffling the man's mouth and trying to suppress his own laughter. Beside them lies a large chunk of venison. The man is unharmed, except that he's missing a glove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walls shake with Little John's laughter. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure changed the color of 'is britches, didn't 'e? ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks to our cannibal friend. Aslan repeats his wildman act, munching on a chunk of venison. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna laugh my bloody balls off. BULL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd the Sheriff be sendin' gold north o' the border? ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To hire mercenaries. The Celts are savage tribesmen, trained to kill from birth.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, the Romans built a bleedin' great wall to keep 'em out. BULL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does 'e want wi 'em? ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since he also has every Smith in the country working in his castle, we can assume he is planning a little war. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agin' who? ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: England.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparks. Smoke. Sweat. The Sheriff inspects his weapon factory. His eyes glint with the reflections of the smithy's fires. A DOOR CRASHES open behind him. FOOTSTEPS. Paying no heed, he draws a sword from a furnace. It's blade white- hot. GISBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were ambushed. In Sherwood Forest. Nottingham tests the sword against an anvil. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spanish steel, cousin. So much stronger than our native blades. Any losses? GISBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the men are gone. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yet again you are the sole survivor, cousin? Interesting. And the gold? GISBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it er... disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Sheriff looks at Gisborne for the first time. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin Hood? GISBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were woodsmen, dressed in green. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin Hood. He places a hand reassuringly on his cousin's shoulder. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cousin, we must be strong. We cannot allow this outlaw to make fools of us. Without warning, he drives the blade into Gisborne's belly. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I cannot allow a lieutenant to fail me. (turning to the horrified smithy) It is indeed fine steel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small procession. Tuck drives his cart, Bull the tax wagon. Both vehicles laden with supplies. Wulf and Hal pass out flour, chickens, blankets, clothing to the villagers. Their weapons are prominently displayed. Tuck swigs from a jar, passes it to an old villager. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God bless you, sir. VILLAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An' Go' bless Robin 'Ood, friar. They says as 'ow none o' the Sheriff's cronies dare go within miles o' Sherwood for fear o' havin' their pockets pinched. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, the good Lord giveth and the good Lord taketh away. OLD WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless Robin Hood takes it first!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Laughter. The procession passes two of the Sheriff's mounted soldiers. They glumly watch as Tuck raises his jug in greeting. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morrow, brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water, sparkling with sunlight. Bursts, as Robin dives in naked. He luxuriates in the cool water... HOOFBEATS. He attempts to hide... too late. Four horses emerge from the trees. Bull and Hal, with Marian and her servant Sarah sandwiched between them. Bull has a black eye. Marian jumps down. MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Robin) How dare you! ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Lady Marian. In response, she starts pelting him with stones. MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You send men to drag me from my home in the middle of the night, like some slave girl? Is this the way the famous Robin Hood treats a lady? ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah well... er, let me finish this bath you wished me to take. Then I'll explain. MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I demand an explanation right now! ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you will be patient, I could spare your propriety by... MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will decide when my propriety is compromised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you wish.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He wades bare-ass naked out of the water towards her. She casts a contemptuous look over his muscled body, glistening with water. MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How dare you expose yourself to me?! She slugs him. Robin stumbles backwards into the water. Bull grins, gesturing to Sarah and pointing to his own black eye. BULL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big 'un did the same to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An arrow flies into a bull's-eye, crudely marked on a tree. Little John lowers his crossbow, delighted at his shot. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Wulf) Right m'lad. Let's see how close you can git to that bugger. Wulf takes aim. His arrow slices clear through his father's arrow, splitting it in two. Little John slaps Wulf on the back and beckons everyone over. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a gander at this 'un, mates. Never seen nuthin' like it in my bloomin' life. Robin leads Marian through the camp... the beginnings of a village -- women doing laundry, kids playing, men prac- ticing archery and swordplay, others working on defenses, camouflaging a giant pit. Marian is impressed, but not about to admit it. MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This better be damned important. Robin leads her into a hut. Inside is a trove of cap- tured loot -- purses, jewelry, weaponry, fancy coats and... the treasure chest. At Robin's nod, Bull throws back the lid. Marian is speechless. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nottingham robs the poor. We rob Nottingham and give back to the poor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think he's going to let you get away with all this? The man is without mercy. He will annihilate you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody has to take a stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're taking a stand with the lives of these people. These young ones. A beat. She checks the faces. Her eyes meet Robin's. Is there a hint of concern for him also?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nottingham was sending this gold to buy reinforcements from the Celtic tribesmen. We need to warn King Richard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nottingham would not dare challenge the King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King is not in England to be challenged, is he? While he is away, he may lose his country. (Marian masks her concern)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are Richard's cousin. You can get word to him. He would believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you want me to participate in your folly? A little girl approaches, holding a bouquet of wild flowers. Touched, Marian kneels to accept the offering.

dialogues.speaker: BOUQUET
dialogues.text: protrudes from Marian's saddle. She is mounted, ready to go. Sarah giggles as she takes her leave of Bull.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Marian) I am sending Duncan with you. Give him some warm food and a real bed. I grow tired of his bellyaching. DUNCAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hah! I have endured more hardship in my lifetime than any man here. Robin laughs and speaks to Marian in a stage whisper. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell him I told you, but he may be useful to you. There is no one to whom I would rather entrust your safety. MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan, you are most welcome. Taking the lead rein from Duncan's horse, she rides away. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls after her) Will you send word to the King? MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A globule of red liquid.    A signet ring.   Marian seals a letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The letter is held in the pudgy, jeweled fingers of the Bishop of Hereford. A lavish office. MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a personal matter, my Lord, but one of vital importance. BISHOP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand, my dear lady. This is my most trusted emissary. He hands the letter to a solemn courier.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will travel to France immediately. You must give this directly into the hands of the King, and him alone. The courier bows in acknowledgement.    Marian indicates Sarah. MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lady-in-waiting will accompany you. Surprised, the courier glances at the Bishop. BISHOP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dear, I could not vouch for her safety. The journey is fraught with danger. MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate your concern, my Lord, but Sarah is an accomplished rider. I must insist that she goes along. BISHOP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) As you wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An informal council of war.   Robin uses a stick in the dirt. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to be ready to move camp at any time. The only way we can be attacked is from the Nottingham Road. We hide lookouts in the trees, here and here. If they see soldiers, they shoot warning arrows. Whistles by day, fire by night. Wulf runs up to Little John in panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father!   Come quick.   Mother's dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fanny Little writhes in agony.    John rushes in.   Tuck looks up from Fanny's side. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The child comes early. Fanny screams.   John kneels beside her, taking her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hush, m'lass.    Ya'll be fine. FANNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'S not like t'others, John.    Oh God, it pains me so. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily, to Tuck) Ya're sittin' thar like a fat sow. Help her, man, help her! FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am doing all I can. Aslan appears in the doorway, with Robin. Whips back the blanket. Fanny's chest is covered with black squirming creatures. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By Allah, leeches! He starts to pull the parasites off.    Tuck jumps at him FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from her! Aslan pushes him away, continuing his work. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood is like air. If she loses blood, she and the child will die. John is paralyzed with confusion.    Tuck appeals to Robi FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lies. He is the devil's seed, sent to lead us astray. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fool, both the Bible and the Koran instruct us to preserve life. Tuck raises an arm to strike Aslan. Robin blocks the blow. Aslan gently touches the mother's stomach.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soothing) Your baby has not turned. It cannot be born without help. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know, you damned savage? ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to John) If you will allow me, I can help her. It will not be without danger. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not listen to him!   He will kill her. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you do not listen to me, she will certainly die. And the child, too. Fanny cries out.   John looks to Robin, pleading for advice. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The good Friar has done all he can. I suggest you let the Arab try. (as John is undecided) If I am wrong, and they die, then you may take my life. John's eyes meet his wife's.   She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So be it. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it will be on your head. I have warned you. He storms out.   All business, Aslan speaks to Wulf. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring me a needle, thread, water, a skinning knife, and burning ashes. Wulf runs to obey. John looks horrified. Robin eases him outside, then returns to Aslan's side. They whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The child must be taken out by the knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The knife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have seen it many times with horses. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horses? By the Lord, what are her chances?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After wasting so much blood... not good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you tell me! Wulf runs back in.     Aslan holds up a piece of wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Fanny) Are you ready?... Bite down on this... Robin, hold her steady. He lifts the red-hot knife from the ashes.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Little John paces. Wulf comes out of the hut.      Famili hover and wait. From inside, MUFFLED GROANS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you, the barbarian is killing her. John moves to the hut.     Wulf restrains him.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: The mother heaves, then drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she gone?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Aslan ignores him, keeps working over Fanny's body. Robin cannot watch... a WAIL! Aslan mutters something in awed Arabic. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say? Aslan holds up a bloody struggling infant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a boy. The mother revives.   Aslan places the child on her breast. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your son, my lady... Robin, hold her skin together while I sew her up. He picks up the needle and thread.   Robin's eyes turn to the woman's abdomen... He faints.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE JOHN
dialogues.text: marches among the cheering families, holding his newborn child high for all to see. Tuck sits miserably to one side. Bloody and  exhausted, Aslan appears at the hut door. Tuck jumps  to his feet, drawing his knife. Heads turn. Tense silence. Robin appears, unsteadily, behind Aslan. Watches, ready to intervene. Tuck stares at Aslan. Raises his blade... and slices down across his own wrist. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This day God has taught me a fine lesson. He hands Aslan the knife and extends his bloodied wrist. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would be honored. Aslan slices his own wrist. The two wrists clasp together in the universal sign of brotherhood. Everyone cheers. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a good man, my barbarian friend. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FRIAR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We shall open a barrel together and I shall do my damndest to save your heathen soul. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alas, I am not permitted... FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our God made this brew, brother. I merely combined the ingredients. Do you dare to insult his works?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hooves fly along a track. Sarah and the courier.    The courier reins in, Sarah draws alongside. SARAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is wrong? COURIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My horse seems to be favoring a foreleg. Sarah leans down to look and the courier cudgels her across the neck. She falls from the saddle, unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flickering candlelight. Marian is alone, reading. A sudden gust extinguishes her candle. HAMMERING and SHOUTING from a distant part of the house. Unnerved, she calls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is there?     Duncan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marian enters stealthily. A candle in one hand, a drawn dagger in the other. Something leaps at her!... A cat, looking for scraps on the kitchen table. She shoos him down. MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off, Nicodemus. Go find mice. She sighs with relief... is grabbed from behind.   A masked SOLDIER.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We meet again. He reveals a large scar on his wrist -- removes his mask -- the man who attacked her earlier. He prods her with his sword. SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop your blade. MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are still overmatched, soldier. She drops the sword. He hurls her against the table. Lays his blade against her chest. SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You owe me favors, wench. Bare your breasts... or I will do it for you. Resignedly, she raises a hand to loosen the string on her dress. With the other hand she reaches behind her, grabs a pepper bowl. Flips the contents into his face. Screaming, he grabs his  face. She reaches for her dagger. He slashes with   his sword. She backs to the fireplace, grabs a spit  of roasted chickens... drives the point clean through  his chest. He stares in shock at his own blood pouring from the cooked fowls pinned to his breast... FOOTSTEPS... masked soldiers converge from both sides of the house, dragging the servants. Duncan  is shoved through the door. DUNCAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am sorry, my lady.    There were too many. She stares at the invaders with studied calm. MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there something you need, gentlemen? I remember no masked ball on my calendar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLYING LOW OVER treetops, OVER an expanse of green, intersected by brown roads and tracks. We are LOOKING AT a detailed scale model of Sherwood Forest in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff and SIX BARONS are gathered around the model. These are the men who revealed their faces to Lord Locksley in the Druid ceremony. Nottingham toys with a white rat on his arm. REDHEAD BARON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about Locksley. He is no threat. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can we control all England if we cannot control our own county? The people are turning him into a hero. GREYBEARD BARON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is impossible to attack him in the forest. We have tried everything. He is cunning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we   will be more cunning. I must be   rid of him. We may not be able   to intercept his next warning   to the King. Sounds of COMMOTION outside. The door swings open. Framed in the doorway is a colossus in black armor. His helmet is the head of a dragon. He slowly raises the visor. Deep tribal scars on his cheeks. Implacable ferocity in his eyes. CELTIC CHIEFTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the heads of the men who stole my gold. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome, sir. We were discussing how to rid ourselves of those very men. The outlaws who band with Robin Hood. REDHEAD BARON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Lord Nottingham, I must protest. It is a mistake to ally ourselves with foreigners. GREYBEARD BARON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can these Celts do that we cannot?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Chieftain strides across to the fire. Grabs a burning log. The Baron backs away in fear. The log spits sparks as the Chieftain raises it above his head... and drives it into his own palm. He stares unblinking at the Baron, holding the log to his hand for a full three seconds. An awed silence. Nottingham grins, delighted with the demonstration. He deposits his white rat onto the model. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This rat Hood has hidden out in the forest.  He resists all our assaults with traps and devices, while he robs us blind. We must bring him out and destroy him. The rat has scurried into the shelter of the model trees. The Chieftain watches impassively, then calmly touches the log to the model. The trees ignite... the RAT SQUEALS in terror and runs. The Chieftain cuts off its escape, setting fire to more trees... again... and again. The Sheriff watches the flames, fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The campfire. Aslan shrieks a war cry.   Dervishes 'round the fire, swigging from a jug. Equally  drunk, the Friar follows, howling, mimicking him. Robin  and the others watch in amusement. Tuck scoops another  jug and hands it to Aslan. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, you son of Saladin. A toast to all of Jehovah's children. The saved and the damned. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This must be a truly evil potion, to make the soul feel this good. He downs the entire jug in one long draught.   Refills it ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, holy man. A toast to all of Allah's children. The true believers and the fat infidels. Tuck laughs and drinks. Aslan sways and topples at the Friar's feet. Heaves up all over the holy sandals. Tuck looks at Robin.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can these Arabs hold Jerusalem when they can't even hold their brew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A masked soldier gallops along.    Hurls a bundle to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Friar and the Saracen lie head to head on the dewey grass. Tuck  snores. Robin shakes Aslan, who grabs for his weapon.  The hangover hits him like a mallet. He clutches his temples. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dancing demon! Good morning. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wincing) If it was Jehovah who created this brew, he is truly wise. He built the punishment into the crime. An ARROW WHISTLES into a tree.    Robin reacts. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They need help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bull and Hal are crouched in the roadway, over a body. Robin runs up with Aslan. He kneels beside them. The body is Duncan. Robin clasps a dead hand... Silence. Fighting his emotions. BULL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bloke wearin' a mask o' the Druids rode by. Tossed 'im down. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure it was a Druid mask? (as Bull nods) Damn them to hell! They must have Marian. Do you know where they meet?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BULL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gregor Caves, I 'eard tell. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will go there. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! You stay here, dammit!    I will go alone. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forget yourself.   I am not your servant. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then be my friend. There are women and children here in greater need of your courage. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considers) Take my eyes, then. He hands Robin his telescope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SQUAWKING ominously, CROWS burst from the trees. Robin rides up the path to the caves that his father took. Checks the ground. Horse tracks. He dismounts, moves cautiously forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one visible. Debris. Smoke rises from ashes. Remnants of a recent ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Robin climbs silently down the rocks into the stone circle. There is blood on the sacrificial altar. Through the opening of the cave, he spies a woman's form, lying face down. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Marian!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He runs forward. Turns the body over. Skin chalk-white from loss of blood... Sarah! A shadow falls across Robin. Before he can react, a cudgel stuns him into blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin's eyes  -- he wakes. Squints around him, the dark smoke-filled  recesses of the caves. The walls weave. Eerie WATERY  sounds, like the CRIES of drowning men. He tries to  stand. VOICE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin!... Robin! A figure in a flowing white robe. Angelic. Floating towards him... Marian. He tries to speak her name. Reaches out his hand. MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death is not to be feared, Robin. Embrace it. Her LAUGH ECHOES around the cave, as if hundreds of lost souls are laughing with her. Robin crawls away, cover- ing his ears. Marian lifts his face to hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink this. Weakly, Robin tries to push away the cup.   Her hand grips his chin, forcing his mouth open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink. The liquid trickles over his lips. He tries to focus. Her features are BLURRED, her voice hypnotic. MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me. Listen to me. You belong to me. Your soul is mine. You will obey my every word. Do you understand? Her face is inches from his. He tries to pull away, his subconscious sounding alarms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, Marian?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you love me. Say it. You love me. (as Robin struggles) Say it! ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sinking) I love you. MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss me. He gives himself to her. Their lips meet... something changes in his vision. Her eyes glow red. Her face starts to shrivel -- He is kissing the wrinkled lips of Mortianna. He pulls away... strong arms grab him. He shakes his head, trying to make sense. Through his BLURRED vision, we see he is surrounded by masked men. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slurred) Where is Marian? MORTIANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is with friends. (cackles) Your resistence is strong, but useless. Sign this. (as quill is forced into his hand) You are a Druid like your father. You consort with the devil. Your confession will be witnessed by the Bishop of Hereford. A guard forces Robin's hand across the page... then cries out, clutching his back... An arrow lodged be- tween his shoulders. In the cave mouth are Wulf, bow in hand, Bull kneeling beside Sarah's corpse, and Aslan. MORTIANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (horror) The painted man! Aslan's war CRY RICHOCHETS off the cave walls. A    curve scimitar in one hand, a straight English sword in   the other, his arms are lethal windmills. The masked    guard are cut down left and right. Mortianna retreats,    scurr ing into the depths of the cave.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bull joins the fray, charging like his namesake, howling in rage, flailing at heads with his quarterstaff. Wulf stays in the mouth, picking off men with deadly accuracy. A furious melee. Bull and Aslan mow down the enemy like hay, battling far superior odds. Soon they are the only two left standing. Bull peers cautiously into the dark- ness. Behind him, one of his victims crawls back to his feet... and lunges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind you! Too late. A sword is driven through Bull's gut. Aslan grabs the attacker by the neck and pile-drives him into the cave wall. The man's SKULL CRACKS against the rocks. Aslan runs to Robin's side, as Wulf hurries to Bull's. Robin is slumped against a rock. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggy) Marian? Aslan runs to the back of the cave, searching. Wulf is crouched beside Bull, who murmurs his dying words. BULL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya be sure Sarah gits a Christian burial. Promise me, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise. Aslan stumbles at the edge of a deep crevasse. Far be- low he sees Mortianna, clambering down the steep rock. For a second their eyes meet. She hisses -- venom, hatred, fear -- then is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aslan carries Robin outside. Robin is staggering, glassy-eyed, mumbling incoherently. His arm blocks the light from his eyes. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have poisoned you. There are herbs that can alter a man's brain. I know of only one cure. He drops to one knee, slams Robin violently across the other. Slaps him on the back and forces his fingers down his throat.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It worked for me this very morning. (as Robin heaves) You will thank me for this later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distant THUNDER. Three horses. First Wulf's, leading another with the bodies of Bull and Sarah draped across its back. Aslan rides the third, with Robin propped up in front of him. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have fulfilled your vow.   Now you can leave. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your gratitude warms my heart. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ignored my request. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is fortunate that I did. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of you, another good man is dead. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He urged me to bring him. He was a brave man and I grieve for him. Praise be to Allah that I do not grieve for you also. Or for my broken vow. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To hell with your damn vow. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am glad you are feeling better. Ahead of them, Wulf shouts and reins in. He points into the distance. A huge cloud of smoke is darkening the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The forest!   Ride!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire.   Blazing rampant. Along a hillside are hundreds of crossbowmen with fire arrows. At a shouted order, another wave of flaming arrows ignites the trees. Behind the crossbowmen are two figures on horseback. One is the Sheriff, in full armor. The other is the black-clad Celtic chieftain. He sits as still as a rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos. Acrid black smoke pours across the clearing. Disarray. COUGHING, SCREAMING, confusion. Little John vainly attempts to instill calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya'll be jus' fine. Lil' smoke ain't gonna kill ya. Scared and injured woodsmen careen out of the trees. Full retreat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (running up) It's burning for miles, John. It's hotter than hades, and them damn screens ain't worth nothing. Two woodsmen, blinded and choking, stumble into one of their own camouflaged pits. Hideous screams as they're impaled on hidden stakes. John tries to gather the able- bodied men to his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Ere, lads... Over 'ere! We must make a stand. Most of them keep on running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn y'all! Ya're no more use than a load o' wet farts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that damn Locksley?   I'll swear he betrayed us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bollocks, Will. Quit yer bloody bellyachin'. Hal runs to join them, stuttering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C... cccc... LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C... ccc? What the bloody hell ya sayin'? Cows?... Cowards?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cccc... elts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celts?   Where? HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing behind him) Gggg... God help us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celts, arrayed behind their Chieftain. An awesome sight. Clad in hides and skins, painted arms and faces, head- pieces the faces of wild animals. Standing in eerie silence. A loud CLAP of THUNDER. Nottingham rides up to the Chieftain. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want prisoners. The Chieftain does not turn his head. CHIEFTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We came to fight. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nevertheless, I need prisoners. With only a short flick of his head, the Chieftain spits. Nottingham waves his arm, signalling his own foot sol- diers to advance. The Chieftain raises his sword. Instantly a tumultuous chilling roar from his warriors. They charge forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bloodcurdling cry fills the sky. Amidst the smoke and chaos, Little John's small band is gathered at the edge of the clearing. WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we gonna do, John?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop 'ere and flippin' well fight 'em, that's what. Whadya say, lads? Half-hearted support from about a dozen men, including Tack. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nay, reveren'. Ya best be goin' wi' the wenches. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This holy man believes in doing God's work with his hands. He snatches a quarterstaff.    John slaps him on the back The men are encouraged. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's give 'em a bloody good wallopin' an' all, lads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aslan reins in. In the valley below, the forest is ablaze. The Sheriff's armed hordes swarm over the em- battled woodsmen. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wulf, stay here. I need your horse. He climbs onto Wulf's horse, steers it right at the heart of the enemy... Aslan blocks his way, grabbing his reins. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?    Out of my way! ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saved your life. I will not let you give it away for no purpose. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of my way, damn you! ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does the witch still have possession of your senses? If we meet up with the survivors we may yet give them some help. And do some damage to the enemy.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Robin debates.   Relents.   They urge their horses into a gallop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff's men stomp through the burning forest. From the other side of the flaming trees, Little John's men pick off shots with their longbows. They retreat, turn and fire again. They back into a clearing... The Celtic mercenaries charge at them across the open ground. The woodsmen drop their bows. Hand-to-hand combat. Woodsmen are being decimated. Little John storms and shouts, cutting down the enemy, inspiring his men. The Scotsmen are awed by this giant. Tuck is confronted by a wild-eyed Celt. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surely you would not harm a man of the cloth? The man swings, Tuck sidesteps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would?   Then to hellfire with you. He pummels the man to the ground with his staff. The woodsmen are broken into two groups. One group, including Will, is surrounded and surrenders. The others fight on. Bleeding from several wounds, Little John is surrounded by four Celts. He spins, challenging them, spitting out expletives. Defiant to the last... suddenly his attackers are hurled aside. Robin rides right through them, slashing with his sword. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bout bleedin' time, mush. Tuck is driven to the ground... his assailant is deliver- ing the lethal blow, when Aslan cuts him down. Tuck glances heavenwards. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Lord. (an afterthought) And thank you, Allah.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Aslan is a   wild man. Steering his horse with just legs and knees,   he strikes out with both swords to left and right. The    momentum is turning. Wulf appears at the edge of the   clearing. Starts picking off stragglers. His father   spots him. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Git the bleedin' 'ell outa there, ya li'l bugger. Distracted, he doesn't see a Celt swing at his back... but Wulf's arrow pierces the man's adam's apple. He freezes in mid-air, before toppling at John's feet. When John turns back, Wulf is being dragged away by three of the Sherrif's men. He attempts to pursue, but is intercepted by two more Celts... and struck down. Aslan charges between the two Celts. Slashes down with both swords. Both men topple to the ground simultaneously. Suddenly all is quiet.    The smoking clearing is a mass of fallen bodies. Only    four men seem to be alive. Robin, Aslan, Tuck, who   is slouched against a tree gasping for breath, and   Hal, who kneels clutching his wounded shoulder. Robin dismounts and runs to Little John. Overwhelmed and exhausted, he slumps over the giant's unmoving form. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't 'ee start bleedin' blubberin', or ya'll make me bloody vomit. Robin manages a relieved smile. Aslan strides over. All around them lie slain Celts and woodsmen. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a fiendish mind that planned this campaign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shovel breaks dirt. Beyond exhaustion, Robin digs a grave. The clearing is transformed into a cemetery. Tuck blesses the bodies of Bull and Sarah. Aslan drags a Celt's corpse into a grave. Throws the man's armor and weapons into a growing pile.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were an honor to your countrymen today, Aslan. You fought better than twenty English knights. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This war is the God of Abraham against the forces of evil. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the war is over. He stares across the desolate clearing. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is too much blood on my hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heavy key turns in a lock. Bolts drawn back. Fol- lowed by guards, Nottingham enters the torture chamber where the captured woodsmen are chained, among them Wulf and Will Scarlet. Putrid ankle-deep water on the floor, walls encrusted with dried blood and grime. Nottingham walks up to the FIRST MAN. Wry smile. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wry smile) Would you prefer pain or death?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death. Dignity masking his terror.    Nottingham appears to consider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torture him. The man is dragged away by guards.    The next PRISONER -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you?   Pain or death? SECOND WOODSMAN (PRISONER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pure terror) ... Er... pain. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torture him... you see, it makes no difference. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NOTTINGHAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will all be tortured. You will all tell me all you know about Robin Hood, and then you will all be hanged. Then we will catch your beloved Robin Hood and do the same to him. WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will kill him for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, no! Nottingham strides up to Will, drawing his sword. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I need you? WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All your attempts to kill him have failed. Your army failed. Your Celtic mercenaries failed. Nottingham places his sword point against Will's throat. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you can succeed? WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am one of his men. He would never suspect me. WULF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows you always hated him, traitor. WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is a trusting fool. He will believe me. If he doesn't, he will kill me and you have lost nothing. Nottingham slides his blade between Will's teeth. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you fail, I will personally cut out your lying tongue. He withdraws the blade.    Will tries to smile. WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I succeed?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His friends will.. (to a guard) ... torture him! He turns back to Will.   A smile of mock apology. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will look better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A winter's night. Bitterly    cold.  Sad figures huddled around a small fire. Fanny    tends to John's wounds, the little ones asleep by their   feet.  John drinks and pass the jug to Tuck, who numbly   shakes his head. Too depressed even to drink. Aslan folds his prayer rug and walks over to Robin, who sits alone, staring vacantly into the darkness. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pride brought us to this. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, friend. It was you who gave these men pride. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave them nothing but false hope. Tomorrow we will disperse. These people can move south and start over. You must go home and win your Jasmina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you? ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am no longer your responsibility. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is for me to decide. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raging) Damn you, Arab. I want you out of my life. Can't you understand that? Go home. Go back to your own kind. Aslan stares at him, then turns away. Not the time for argument. Robin fingers his father's medallion... rips it from his neck.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn you, too, Father.   You reared a coward and a fool. He hurls the medallion... it catches on a low-hanging branch.

dialogues.speaker: NOVEMBER MOON
dialogues.text: Watery, full. The FOCUS SHIFTS TO the medallion, dangling in its center... the last thing Robin sees before his eyes close into troubled sleep. The white moon against the black sky...

dialogues.speaker: ITS NEGATIVE IMAGE
dialogues.text: -- a black circle against a white sky. An executioner. The round medallion has become a noose. In the noose appears Wulf's face. The executioner hauls on the rope and Wulf's features contort in the agony of death. Another noose, another face... Duncan. Another -- Bull. Another -- Marian. MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss me, Robin. The noose tightens on her neck. As she dies, her face shrivels into the cackling features of Mortianna. Next, Robin's father.   He stares accusingly right AT us. LOCKSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why have you betrayed me?   Why? Before he pulls the rope, the executioner peels back his hood... It is Robin. Gloating, he hauls on the rope. His laughter blends with that of Mortianna in a hideous cacophony.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN'S FACE
dialogues.text: DISTORTED in water. The LAUGHTER BECOMES the sound of a RUNNING RIVER. Robin is washing, trying to drive away the horror.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The first streaks of light fight their way through a thick, morning mist. Out of the mist steps a figure, at first indecipherable. Aware of his presence, Robin looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will!    I thought you were taken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you escape? WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And will you? Before Will can answer, Little John runs up.     Grabs Will's throat. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll wring yer scrawny neck, Will Scarlet. I'd be doin' yer a bloody favor an' all. Quickly, others arrive. Aslan, Tuck, Hal, Fanny, with kids clinging to her skirts. FANNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afore ya kill 'im, John, ask 'im if Wulf be still alive. Will is choking, unable to speak. John loosens his hold just enough for Will to splutter out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y... e... LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Git us a rope, Hal, and we'll put the bleedin' weasel outa 'is misery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, wait.    Let us hear what he has to say. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No bugger 'scapes the Sheriff, 'nless 'e's linin' 'is bloomin' pockets.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A traitor sneaks in and out under cover of darkness. Will walked in and announced himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismissive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye.    'E always did 'ave balls o' brass. HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's sss... string 'im up. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him speak. John reluctantly moves his hold from Will's neck to his shoulders. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Search 'im, Hal. 'E'll 'ave a bloody blade on 'im somewheres. Will eyes the accusing faces. Hal searches, lifts Will's shirt. His whole skin is lacerated with deep gashes and fresh burns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bugger me. He steps back.    Ready to listen. WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bring a message from Nottingham. Our men are to be hung in the square on Saturday. At high noon. FANNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about my boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy, too.    Ten men in all. Fanny drops her head on John's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their   deaths are a warning. Anyone   who associates with the outlaw   Hood is to suffer the same fate.    Man, woman, or child. Even anyone   who so much as utters his name.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin Hood! Robin Hood! Robin Hood! (chuckles) May as well be hung for a sheep as a lamb. WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hangings are to be part of the celebration for the Sheriff's marriage. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marriage, eh? What lucky wench gits to play with the Sheriff's codpiece? Will turns his gaze directly on Robin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady Marian. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a bride of royal blood? LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, and then with King Richard gone, he takes the bloody throne. Everyone reacts with shock.     Only Robin appears unsur- prised. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were to use this news to get close to me, and then kill me? Right, Will? WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sly grin) Not straightway, of course. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your intention, Will? WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That depends on you, Locksley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How so? WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never trusted you, that's no secret. What I wanna know is, are you gonna finish what you started?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Robin is on the spot.    All eyes on him.   Will presses point. WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will ya stay and keep us fightin' till every man jack of us is dead? Or will you run like the spoiled little rich boy I always took you for? ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You present quite a choice.    What would you have me do, Will? WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you run, I will kill you. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I stay, will you all stay with me? Robin checks the other faces. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the end, friend. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If my heathen brother stays, I stay. HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm... meee... tttt... He can't get it out.    Little John covers Hal's mouth. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'E's in. We're all bloody in. Daft buggers. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's your answer, Will.    We finish it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten gallows, silhouetted against the setting sun. The black-armored Celt tests a gallows, springing the hatch. A heavy sack dangles from the rope. Grim-faced peasants watch. Among  them -- Fanny Little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of the gallows ECHOES inside the damp, stone walls. Wulf and the other woodsmen are chained to rings in the floor. Wulf lifts his eyes to a chink of light high in the wall. The purple sky is turning black. He fingers his wooden crucifix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it be your biddin' that this be my last night o' life, Lord, gimme the pluck to die proud. An' look 'ee kindly on my folks an' the young 'uns. The light in the cell melts to total darkness.

dialogues.speaker: BRANCHES
dialogues.text: Sunlight glistens on frost-laden branches.      A COCK RO CHIRPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the troubled human realm, Tuck says his morning prayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord, grant us the courage to endure, and if you're as smart as I believe you are, grant us victory... and the victuals to celebrate it with. Aslan is crushing charcoal into a mixture of yellow powder, which is turning black. Tuck approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you pray with me, son of Allah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have prayed for you, often, my brother. But, let us put prayer aside and help our gods in a more practical manner. I must reveal to you the mysteries of the black powder. Tuck takes a bowl of the powder close to the fire to examine it. Aslan snatches it back... Before Tuck can react, Robin walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will it work? Aslan throws a handful of powder into the firel A fire- ball rips ten feet in the air... Tuck falls on his ass in terror. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed) You are truly a wizard. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no such thing. But if there was... (chuckles) ... I would surely be one. Robin reaches out and shakes Aslan's hand. A moment of bonding. He moves on to the others, clasping each man's hand as he speaks. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have no armored knights, no glorious banners. But I am honored to be going to battle in this company. Today we fight not just for the lives of our friends, but to save all England. A moment of tension before Will takes the proferred hand. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We may be only six men, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven! She strides towards them from the trees. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in blazes ya doin', woman? Where's the little 'uns? FANNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Them's safe, wi' my mother. (pushes past Little John) Robin, I been to town an' seen the scaffold and the guard towers. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya gone bleedin' cracked, girl?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FANNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go an' birth eight babies and then you can come an' tell me 'bout hurtin', ya big ox. I ain't gonna sit aroun' an' let one o' 'em die, neither. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya should be bloody well mindin' the other seven. Tell 'er, Rob. Robin starts to draw a diagram on the ground with a stick. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fanny, show me the exact location of the scaffold. Little John double-takes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gallows. Swathed in a pink glow. A brilliant, wintry morning. Breath billows from the mouths of the sentries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boots clack confidently down a stone corridor. The Sheriff decked in wedding finery. He enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Mortianna's apothecary. Dark, smoke-filled. Foul things in jars. Animals in cages, waiting to meet unspeakable ends. Marian is strapped in a chair, flanked by two armed guards. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is my bride? Marian smiles as he leans toward her... and spits in his face. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... You are overwhelmed with happiness. He slowly wipes off the spittle... and slaps her hard.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calm, uncowed) I will never marry you. Mortianna emerges from a dark corner, bearing the goblet she used at the Druid ceremony. MORTIANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold her! Marian struggles against her bonds. MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me, you disgusting hag. I will not... augh! The guards viciously restrain her, forcing her mouth open. Mortianna pours the blood-red liquid down her throat.
