Marian fights, gagging and choking... until the drug takes its effect. She slumps forward. Nottingham watches with amusement. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mortianna) When we are married, thirty of the northern barons will pledge me their support as king. As you predicted. Mortianna squats on the floor besides a platter of blood. Clasps the dice-like runes. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you see in the portents? Mortianna rocks on her heels, clutching her taloned hands to her sides. She chants, fingering the bloody stones. MORTIANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The union. The blood of the lion and the house of Nottingham. New faith. New power. New souls. She stares at Nottingham, her red eyes demented. MORTIANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there is no union, there will be darkness, despair, death. Ours! NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Di not give me riddles, woman. We are to be married within hours. How can we be in danger?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MORTIANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blood does not lie. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Tell me how it will result. MORTIANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have told you what I know. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confound you, crone. Without my protection, the people would hunt you down, rip out your black heart and burn it. Mortianna runs at him.   Points her bony finger at his heart. MORTIANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without me, you are nothing. You are straw, a fleabite, a speck. (as Nottingham laughs) Laugh, fool. I birthed you from this body. I stole a babe in this very castle, and killed it so that you might rise in its place. You are my son. (Nottingham is too shocked to react) Together we are strong. Now is not the time to doubt. Now is the time to believe, to be bold. The bold will prevail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Masses stream in. They give wide berth to a Celtic war- rior in a boar's head helmet. Soldiers prod and harness the passing peasants. Tuck drives a cartload of barrels. A GUARD stops him. GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you got there, Father? FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lord's finest brew for the good Nottingham's fighting men. It has a mighty kick.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) I'll warrant. Pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wulf blinks at the sunlight as the prisoners are led out. Holds his head high. Soldiers hurl abuse, the people are too cowed to show support. Fanny glances at her son, crosses herself and scurries into the castle, unnoticed. On horseback, encircled by guards, the Sheriff and his baron cronies watch the outlaws progress with cruel amusement. A  yell attracts Nottingham. Will is being shoved back by guards. WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff! My Lord Sheriff! I have word for you! Of Robin Hood! Nottingham shouts to one of his mounted guards, who rides over, grabs Will by the collar, and drags him to his side. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, the turncoat. Did you succeed? WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found his lair, but alas he still lives. The Sheriff strikes down with his armored hand.    Will crumples. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stretch his neck with the others. Hands yank Will to his feet. Dazed, he tries to speak. Disinterested, Nottingham turns away, until he catches... WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...He... He... is here! NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Locksley, here? Where ? Will struggles to get free of his holders. WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call off your dogs. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Release him!... Now, where is he?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want your word, in front of these witnesses. If I tell you, I will go free. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scoffs) We will find him. WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is concealed. He is going to free the prisoners and stop the wedding. Nottingham's jaw tightens.   Eyes the prisoners, the scaffold. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put Hood in my hands, you go free. WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the reward. Ten thousand crowns. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn your worthless hide!    Just tell me where he is. WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reward! The parade of prisoners reaches them. Seeing Will, Wulf charges at him, screaming in blind rage. Soldiers grab Wulf. Throw him down, kicking and beating. Voices in the crowd plead to let him be. Someone tries to intervene, gets hurled down. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Will) You'll get your reward. Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck urges his ancient nag towards the scaffold with his cargo of barrels. The crowd parts unwillingly. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the way. Make way for the Lord's business.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Across the square, Will points urgently in Tuck's direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive oak stands near the southern wall. A large figure climbs to its uppermost branches. Little John. He scrambles from the tree, starts to climb the wall itself. He slips frequently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prisoners are led to the scaffold, where the hooded executioner waits, along with the Chieftain. Wulf staggers, from his beating. Nottingham's men encircle Tuck's cart.    He watches them nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fanny lowers a knotted rope over the battlement. Far below, John clings to the outer wall. Above him it's sheer, without footholds. The rope doesn't reach his fingertips. He stretches, loses balance. Falls... desperately grabbing at the rope. He swings, clinging by one arm, his body smashing into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will leads the Sheriff to Tuck's cart. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step down, friar. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you wish, sire. Is there something amiss? NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man claims you have outlaws concealed in these barrels. Among them the cursed Robin Hood. Tuck glares at Will with unconcealed hatred. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man will rot in hell as a knave and a liar. These are libations for the celebration of your lordship's nuptials.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Break one open! FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous) Why waste fine vintage, my lord? A cask is shattered... wine torrents out. WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try another. There are many barrels, only a few outlaws. A drum roll. The Sheriff's attention turns to the scaffold, where the first victim is escorted up the steps -- Wulf. Tense, Tuck pulls a tinder box from his robes, strikes a flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John strains, heaving his giant frame up the rope. He nears the top, just as a SENTRY approaches. Fanny blocks the man's view. SENTRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your business, woman? FANNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't doin' no 'arm, m'dear. Likes a good 'angin', I do. Luvly view up 'ere, ain't it? She gestures below. The Sentry looks, then turns back to her... notices the rope. With all her might, Fanny rams his head into the stone battlement. Twice. Three times. He slumps unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wulf crosses himself as the executioner steers him to the noose. A hush falls... except for a rotund old woman who is barging to the front. And a WOUNDED SOLDIER, his head bandaged, who eases her path, striking out with his tree- branch crutch. WOUNDED SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give room for a fightin' man and his ma. Step aside, or I'll make ya. I wanna see the bastards walk on air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John struggles over the battlement.   Collapses. FANNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bout time, ya gurt lug. She wrenches the longbow from his back, fumbles for an arrow. FANNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We be too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scaffold is impregnable. Celts and their Chieftain guard the platform itself. The Sherriff's men surround the base. The executioner encircles Wulf's neck with the noose. SPARKS! Tuck ignites a fuse-cord leading to one of the barrels. A hand tightens the noose... Another grasps an arrow. The executioner's eyes glint through the slits. Nottingham intently watches Wulf. The Chieftain stands, impassive. Fingers close on a bowstring... the fuse-cord burns. Wulf steps to the trap, ready to plunge.   His eyes close An arrow flies... slices through the executioner's eye slit. The executioner falls. Little John celebrates... but the Chieftain leaps forward... releases the trap. Wulf's body plunges.   The rope snaps tight. Little John yells.   Fanny screams. A figure leaps onto the platform... the wounded soldier throws aside his crutch... Robin! Wulf dangles, strangling.   His hands wrench at the choking cord.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The burning fuse-cord reaches the barrel. Tuck hurls the smoking barrel thundering towards the Sheriff... Spotting it, Nottingham urges his horse over his own men in his effort to escape. The Chieftain smites at Robin... his blow is blocked... by the Celt with the boar's head. KAABOOM! The GUNPOWDER in the barrel EXPLODES. Spewing smoke and wood. SCREAMS of panic. Soldiers fly. Mass confusion. Amidst the smoke... Robin's sword slashes through Wulf's rope. He hauls him onto the platform. Another figure on the platform... the old woman. Slashes the ropes of the other prisoners. Whips off her wig... It's Hal. He passes out weapons from a bundle under his arm. HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here... By God... Let's fight 'em! WOODSMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal! What happened to your stutter? HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gg... ggg... g..oh crap! A guard attacks, Hal fells him. HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take that, ya mug. No stutter this time!    The woodsmen join battle with th guards. The Chieftain cudgels his Celt attacker across the head. The boar's head helmet tumbles... revealing Aslan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impostor!   You dishonor the clan. Aslan retreats, fending off the Chieftain's shattering blows.

dialogues.speaker: FROM PARAPET
dialogues.text: John and Fanny peer down as the smoke clears. They watch Wulf struggle to his feet. A Celt sneaks up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fight fair...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He aims.   Grits his teeth... picks off the Celt with a shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Or don't fight at all.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCENE
dialogues.text: Robin leaps and swings from gallows to gallows, kicking out, slashing down. Sends two Celts hurtling down the trap hole. Will battles the Sheriff. A reprise of his own fight with Robin, the roles reversed. The Sheriff, armed and mounted, flails at Will, who, unarmed, dodges in and around the horse's legs. Aslan and the Chieftain are locked in mortal combat. Aslan stumbles back and falls. The Chieftain swipes at his head. Aslan rolls aside. The sword smashes wood. Tuck surrounded, rolls another smoking BARREL... It EXPLODES. The Greybeard Baron spots Little John and Fanny on the parapet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up there!   No mercy, shoot them! Crossbowmen on the opposite parapet fire.      Bolts rico all around Little John and Fanny.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCAFFOLD
dialogues.text: Wulf guards the steps, beating back all comers.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCENE
dialogues.text: Aslan evades the charging Chieftain. Drop-kicks a soldier, takes his sword, and whirls back at the Chieftain. His blows have no effect on the Scot's black armor. The Sheriff rears his horse... hooves flail.. knocking Will to his knees. The Sheriff lunges... Desperate, Will grasps the sword, ignoring the pain... a tug of war. Blood pours from Will's hands, where the blade cuts in. He suddenly lets go... Nottingham topples from his horse. Will leaps on him.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pain or death, you butcher? The Sheriff's men drag Will off before he can choke him. Raging, Nottingham climbs to his feet. Will is held by four men. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's another message to Robin Hood, written in your blood. He drives his sword repeatedly, insanely, into Will's belly. WILL SCARLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over, fool. You can kill my body, but you cannot kill our spirit. He finally drops... Nottingham heads for the castle. Robin attempts to follow. He swings from the noose, using the rope to vault over the surrounding soldiers. As he lands, he is waylaid by one of the barons and his men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Hood!   Get him! The Chieftain knocks Aslan down.   Aslan loses his sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am iron.   I am rock. I am your death. Aslan spots one of John's arrows protruding from a dead Celt's back. Scrambles over and tears it out. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talk too much! He leaps... rams the arrow through the Chieftain's mouthpiece... out the back of his neck. The Chieftain grabs his helmet, trying to rip it off. He topples, his life's blood gushing from both sides of his neck. Aslan plants a foot on the slain warrior. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Englishmen! I am not one of you, yet I fight for you. Against a tyrant. Join me now. Join Robin Hood. The onlookers are inspired. Grabbing weapons from fallen soldiers, many join the fray.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Nottingham runs through the castle gate.   Angry peasants pursue. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lower the portcullis! Now! A guard winds down the giant gate.   Nottingham hurls him aside. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too slow, fool! He hacks at the ropes. The gate slices down like a guillotine, pinning soldiers and peasants alike. Fighting his way towards the gate, Robin sees   with dism that the portcullis is closed. Weakening, he    staves of the redhead baron's vicious assault. Suddenly    peasants are swarming over his attacker. The baron is    dragged o and trampled down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends!   We must raise the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crossbow bolts fly. Little John ducks and weaves, while spinning and firing at the men advancing at him from both sides. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, ya ckicken-'earted buggers. Ya milksops, ya bleedin' pansies. He can't shoot fast enough. As they descend on him, he leaps from the battlements onto a soldier's back. Grabs his sword. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, m 'old cock. Ya mind if I borrow this? He's backed up against a battlement, outnumbered five to one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin and the others try in vain to lift the portcullis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff marches through, issuing orders.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seal the entrance. Guard it with your lives. ... Bring the bishop to my chapel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surrounded by flickering candles, Marian sits before a mirror. In a white wedding gown. Her eyes faraway, lifeless, in deep trance. Mortianna sensuously combs the bride's hair with her taloned fingers. The Sheriff's face appears in the reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come!   It is time for the union. The guards roughly haul Marian to her feet.    She is oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once, Christian, now blasphemously transformed   to the practice of black magic. The crucifix on the    altar is upside down. Marian stands before it, between    the Sheriff and Mortianna. The Bishop is dragged    in. Frightened. The BATTLE SOUNDS ECHO. BISHOP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are rebelling. We must escape. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marry us. When I am declared king, that rabble will not dare go against us. BISHOP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is is madness to delay. Mortianna screams and slashes her talons across the Bishop's outstretched hands. Blood flows. MORTIANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face them, or face me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin leaps onto Tuck's cart. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light all the barrels, Tuck.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Robin snaps the reins, steering the rumbling cart across the yard. Bouncing in the back, Tuck lights barrels. FUSES smoke and CRACKLE. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jump! Tuck jumps. Robin steers the wagon at the gate. At the last second, he slashes the reins and leaps onto the horse's back... The BARRELS EXPLODE! The portcullis is blown to kingdom come. Out of the smoke, Robin rides the old nag like a charger. Leads his cheering, ragged fighters through the open gate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fanny is chased into the kitchens by a vengeful soldier. He grabs her and pushes her into the open cooking fire. Desperate, she grabs a poker and smashes him over the head. The servants stare in shock... A chef comes at Fanny with a knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal and the others battle against huge odds. More peasants join them, daring to take on the Sheriff's hated men. Aslan's a whirlwind,  striking out in all directions. Each blow for  a cause. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Allah!... For Jehovah! For brotherhood!... For justice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door SLAMS back. Robin bursts through. Alone, against three attackers. He swings a soldier around. Holds him as a shield, using the man's own sword against his companions. In seconds, all three are down and Robin is off and running. Down corridors, searching. Soldiers and armed servants converge to block his way. Robin strikes, vaults, flings statues. Up the stairs... topples a suit of armor down on his pursuers. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing a servant) Where is she? Where is Lady Marian?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The man refuses to speak. Robin looks up the corridor, sees six men guarding the private chapel's arched door- way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah!   There is my answer. He hurls the man aside... The armed guards charge him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying a flaming torch, Tuck runs down the dark passage ways. Before him, an awesome sight... dozens of pitiful men in cages. Suddenly he is confronted by the jailer. A cruel behemoth of a man, carrying a spiked club. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pious) My son, there is a holy war being waged outside. Release all these wretches and God shall surely find you a place in heaven. JAILER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather go to hell! WHAM! Tuck takes the lethal cudgel full in the chest. Flies back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweating, fearful, the Bishop rushes through the service. BISHOP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...your bodies to be bound in immortal wedlock. Do you, Marian Dubois, take... The chapel DOORS SHATTER inward. Robin backs in, bloodied, fencing with four remaining soldiers. He smashes one by swinging the heavy door into him, hurtles a pew at another. He springs off another pew, taking down a third.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marian, run!   It's me, Robin. Run! Marian remains immobile. Mortianna moves to her side. Robin is struck in the thigh. Like a vulture, the Sheriff waits. Tiring, blood pouring from his leg, Robin prepares to fight him.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I warned you, I would find you no matter what. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No companions? No army? You rush to your death for the sake of a woman. Lust has turned you into a fool... Recognize this, Locksley? He raises his sword to reveal its handle. A crucifix sculpted into the hilt... Robin's father's sword. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appropriate I should use it to kill you with, don't you think? He lunges. A savage, accomplished swordsman, with fire in his eyes. Exhausted, Robin is driven back, parrying desperately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck picks himself up from the floor.    The jailer is amazed. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lord helps those who help themselves. Grinning, he pulls open his robes, revealing chest armor ... and a miniature powder keg. He holds it to his flaming torch and tosses it to the jailer... Stupified, the man catches the smoking bomb. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give my regards to the devil. The KEG ERUPTS, blowing the jailer through a wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is in deep trouble, but undaunted. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya gutless bloody sissies. Someone attacks his assailants from the rear.    The tide turns. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wulf! I told ya to keep outa the fightin'.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WULF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Father. Couldn't help myself. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, ya'll get a bloody good wallopin' if we get 'ome... For now, let's see how well I taught ya. Wulf sends an attacker plummeting off the parapet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crossbow bolt strikes Hal between his shoulder blades. He falls. The Sheriff's soldiers are regaining the advantage. The peasants are giving up, dropping their weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!   Fight on. Fight! He sees a familiar pair of holy sandals marching towards him. Tuck leading a barefoot army. Dozens of ragged prisoners, armed with chains and torture implements. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sinners, beware! God's avengers are at hand. Dying, Hal manages a weak smile. HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go' bless ya, Tuck. Tuck flails a chain at a Celt. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Repent, heathen! The man spins to strike back... freezes... grinning... Aslan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chef raises his knife.    Fanny appeals to the whole room. FANNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen! Outside, your countrymen rise against the Sheriff. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FANNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there one man or woman here who does not hate him? Who has not suffered at his hand? (to the chef) Turn that on the Sheriff and his bullies. A deadly pause. A woman cook dumps the giant wedding cake right over the chef. Suddenly it's havoc. Flying food and cutlery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A full-scale riot. The populace has turned. Into the fray comes Fanny Little, leading a rabble of servants and kitchen staff, fighting with pots, pans, brooms, knives, hooks, and bedpans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nottingham slashes maniacally.   Robin is cornered, weakening. NOTTINGHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have stayed away, Locksley. Fools like you never learn. A blow slices Robin's arm. His sword flies from his grasp. Nottingham gloats. Two of his men scramble back to their feet. Robin is beat... a war cry! Aslan, followed by Tuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali akbar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen! MORTIANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing Aslan) Agh... the painted one! Nottingham glances over... a split-second opportunity!... Robin lashes out. Kicks the Sheriff in the gut, chops down his sword hand. His father's sword clatters to the floor. Whirling swords in each hand, Aslan attacks the other men. Robin pile-drives Nottingham into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Bishop makes his escape.    Tuck blocks his path. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So! You sold your soul to the devil? BISHOP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I swear it, in God's name. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blasphemer! You accuse innocent men of Druid worship while you practice the black arts yourself. The Bishop surreptitiously draws a dagger from his robes. A taloned hand grips a spear... Mortianna creeps up on Aslan. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glimpsing her) Watch out! Aslan spins... too late. Screeching, Mortianna drives the spear into Aslan's side. He cries out and slides to the floor. Nottingham uses Robin's distraction to regain his sword. Back on the defensive, Robin tries to evade the blows. Mortianna drags Marian out onto a balcony. Robin cannot pursue. In acute pain, Aslan struggles to his feet. Grasping the spear where it enters his side, he pulls wit all his strength. The Bishop, concealed dagger in hand, approaches Tuck. BISHOP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (innocently) I am sure you would not strike a man of the cloth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think again! Without an eyeblink's pause, Tuck punches the Bishop so hard, he flies back THROUGH a stained-glass WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mortianna hauls Marian against the battlements. Peers down at the battle. She spins in shock at Aslan's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you fear is not below. He charges at her with the bloody spear. She screams hideously as he thrusts it right through her chest. Her madness is superhuman. With strength beyond all reason, she crawls up the spear's shaft, forcing it further through her body in her effort to get at him. Clutching, screeching, hissing. Her talons groping at his face, Aslan strains to the last ounce of his will and heaves her over the battle- ments. With an ear-splitting shriek, she plummets to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sword raised, Nottingham has Robin backed against the altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can your puny God do for you now? The blade comes whirring down... clang! It's blocked. Robin has the altar's crucifix in his hand. He swings it again, slamming Nottingham across the temple.  The Sheriff hits the floor. Robin grabs his father's sword. Raises it two-fisted. Nottingham tries to squirm away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is for my father. He drives the sword down, like a stake, right through Nottingham's heart. The man shudders, and is still. Robin stands over him. Drained. Tuck rushes outside. Kneels at Aslan's side. Robin spots Marian swaying on the edge of the steep parapet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin grabs Marian, pulling her back. Carefully lifts her face. Her lifeless eyes suddenly flash. She lashes out. A spitfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go!   Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (restraining her) I'm your sworn protector.   Any way I see fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin emerges from the castle. Draped over his shoulder, Marian is kicking and beating at him. He reaches the fountain in the center of the square and tosses her into the freezing water. She leaps to her feet, yelling. Slips and tumbles back. Water streams from her bridal gown. A crowd gathers, enjoying the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin?   Oh God, is that you? She stumbles out of the fountain... and storms at him, pounding her fists on his chest. MARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How dare you?! Robin grins at the crowd. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she's feeling better. Marian looks about her... the chaotic aftermath of battle. Reality gradually sinks in. She folds against Robin's chest. Little John arrives, his huge arms enfolding Wulf and Fanny. LITTLE JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We done it, mate. We clobbered the buggers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you 'urt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will mend. He spots a group kneeling beside the fallen body of Aslan. His smile fades. He runs over. Cradles Aslan's head. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aslan, my friend.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going home the easy way, Robin. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking Aslan) You die on me, you son of satan, and I swear I'll bury you as a Christian in St. Catherine's Cathedral with a thousand monks chanting prayers for your miserable soul. You hear me? ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly) I have no strength, Brother Tuck. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kicking him) A fine friend you are! By the grace of Allah and Jehovah we have won the day, and you want to give up the ghost. I'll pickle your remains in mead, lay you in your grave with a pig for a companion, and mark it with a cross as big as this castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please!   It hurts when I laugh. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See. There's life in the heathen dog yet. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Here, Tuck. Look after him.    You deserve each other. Robin stands, Marian joins him. Around them cheering grows, till the whole crowd is in unison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin Hood!   Robin Hood!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VOICE ECHOES from the vaulted roof.   A wedding is in progress.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FRIAR (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the power vested in me by God's holy church, I now pronounce you husband and wife. Tuck is performing the ceremony before the happy couple. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may kiss the bride. The husband draws back the bride's veil.    Robin and Marian. They kiss... long. FRIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Hurry. We waste good celebration time. They break   the embrace, turn to the congregation and start down   the aisle. They pause at the front pew, where KING   RICHARD and members of his court are sitting Robin bows,   Marian curtsies. KING RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I kiss the bride? ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who would dare refuse his king's request? KING RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing Marian's cheek) You look radiant, cousin. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are deeply honored by Your Majesty's presence. KING RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is I who am honored, Lord Locksley. Thanks to you I still have a throne. They continue down the aisle, past the smiling congre- gation. Waiting by the door is Aslan. He and Robin embrace. ASLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) My friend, a word of advice... Ride her better than your horse. Robin laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WEDDING BELLS PEAL. Robin and Marian step out into the sunlight. The crowd cheers. At a signal from Little John, the ex-outlaws shoot flaming arrows into the sky... FIREWORKS...
